question_en: How do I submit an e-invoice using Duplo?
question_pidgin: How I go submit e-invoice with Duplo?
answer_en: Use Duplo API (OAuth 2.0): Prepare UBL 3.0 XML with 55 mandatory fields (e.g., cbc:ID, cbc:IssueDate, cac:AccountingSupplierParty with TIN, cac:InvoiceLine for items/taxRate=7.5, cac:TaxTotal, cac:LegalMonetaryTotal). POST to /v1/einvoice/submit; get IRN/stamp. TaxBridge automates this—chat 'Submit invoice' to start.
answer_pidgin: Use Duplo API: Make UBL XML with important parts like ID, date, your TIN, items with 7.5% VAT, total. Send to dem endpoint; get stamp. TaxBridge go do am—say 'Submit invoice'.

question_en: How do I make a tax payment with Remita?
question_pidgin: How I go pay tax with Remita?

question_en: What is the VAT rate for 2026?
question_pidgin: Wetin be VAT rate for 2026?
answer_en: VAT rate remains 7.5% for 2026 under Nigeria Tax Act 2025. All taxable goods and services must charge 7.5% VAT. Exemptions include basic food items, medical supplies, and educational services.
answer_pidgin: VAT still be 7.5% for 2026. Everything wey sell must get 7.5% VAT, except food, medicine, and school things.

question_en: Is e-invoicing mandatory in 2026?
question_pidgin: E-invoicing compulsory for 2026?
answer_en: Yes, e-invoicing is mandatory for all businesses with turnover > NGN 25M annually. Must use NITDA-accredited APP like Duplo. Invoices must be in UBL 3.0 format and submitted to NRS within 24 hours of issuance.
answer_pidgin: Yes, if your business pass NGN 25M per year, you must use e-invoice. You need APP like Duplo, and format must be UBL 3.0.

question_en: What are the required UBL 3.0 fields for e-invoices?
question_pidgin: Wetin be the important UBL 3.0 fields for e-invoice?
answer_en: UBL 3.0 requires 55 mandatory fields: cbc:ID (invoice number), cbc:IssueDate, cbc:InvoiceTypeCode, cac:AccountingSupplierParty (with TIN), cac:AccountingCustomerParty, cac:InvoiceLine (items with quantity/price/VAT), cac:TaxTotal, cac:LegalMonetaryTotal (lineExtensionAmount, taxInclusiveAmount, payableAmount).
answer_pidgin: UBL 3.0 need 55 important things: invoice number, date, customer TIN, your TIN, items wey you sell with price, VAT, and total amount.

question_en: What is the tax exemption threshold for small businesses?
question_pidgin: How much small business no go pay tax?
answer_en: Businesses with annual turnover < NGN 800,000 are exempt from Company Income Tax. However, VAT registration and filing may still be required if turnover > NGN 25M. E-invoicing compliance still applies.
answer_pidgin: If your business no reach NGN 800,000 per year, you no go pay company tax. But if you pass NGN 25M, you still need to do VAT and e-invoice.

question_en: What is the withholding tax rate for foreign payments?
question_pidgin: How much be withholding tax for foreign money?
answer_en: Withholding tax on foreign payments to non-residents is 10% for royalties, dividends, interest, and technical services under Nigeria Tax Act 2025. Must be deducted at source and remitted to NRS.
answer_pidgin: For foreign people wey you pay, you must remove 10% tax from royalty, dividend, interest, and service money before you pay dem.

question_en: What are the penalties for late tax filing?
question_pidgin: Wetin be punishment if I late file tax?
answer_en: Late filing penalty: NGN 25,000 for first month, NGN 5,000 for subsequent months. Interest accrues at 21% per annum on unpaid tax. E-invoice non-compliance: NGN 100,000 per invoice or 2% of turnover, whichever is higher.
answer_pidgin: If you late file tax, na NGN 25,000 for first month, then NGN 5,000 every other month. Government go still charge 21% interest on the money wey you owe.

question_pidgin: How NRS digital audit dey work for 2026?
answer_en: NRS uses AI-powered real-time audit on all e-invoices. System flags anomalies: missing TINs, incorrect VAT calculations, duplicate invoices, and suspicious patterns. High-risk businesses get monthly compliance reviews. Keep clean records to avoid audit triggers.

question_en: What is Peppol BIS Billing 3.0 compliance?
question_pidgin: Wetin be Peppol BIS Billing 3.0 compliance?
answer_en: Peppol BIS Billing 3.0 (May 2025) is the international standard for e-invoices adopted by NRS. Ensures cross-border compatibility and automated processing. Your UBL 3.0 invoices must follow Peppol profile: urn:fdc:peppol.eu:2017:poacc:billing:01:1.0
answer_pidgin: Peppol be international rule for e-invoice wey NRS follow. Your invoice must follow this format so e go work for other countries too.

question_en: What are the tax filing deadlines for 2026?
question_pidgin: When be tax deadline for 2026?
answer_en: Company Income Tax: 6 months after financial year end. VAT: Monthly filing by 21st of following month. Withholding Tax: 21st of month following deduction. E-invoice submission: Within 24 hours of issuance.

question_en: What about cross-border transactions?
question_pidgin: Wetin about transactions wey involve other countries?
answer_en: Exports: zero-rated VAT (0%). Imports: VAT + customs duty at point of entry. Services to non-residents: may be exempt. Withholding tax applies to foreign payments. Use Peppol for international e-invoices.
answer_pidgin: If you sell things for other countries, no VAT (0%). If you buy from outside, you go pay VAT and customs duty. For foreign payments, withholding tax apply.

question_en: How do I handle employee taxes?
question_pidgin: How I go handle employee tax?
answer_en: Register for PAYE, deduct monthly from salaries. Rates: 7% (NGN 300K), 11% (NGN 300K-600K), 15% (NGN 600K-1.1M), 19% (NGN 1.1M-1.6M), 21% (NGN 1.6M-3.2M), 24% (>NGN 3.2M). Remit to NRS by 10th of following month.
answer_pidgin: Register for PAYE, remove tax from salary every month. The percentage depend on how much the person earn. Pay the money to NRS before 10th of next month.

question_pidgin: Tax guide for new business?

answer_pidgin: Register your business with CAC, get TIN, open business account. If you go make more than NGN 25M, register for VAT. Start keeping records from day one.

question_en: How do I dispute tax assessments?
question_pidgin: How I go argue if tax assessment no correct?
answer_en: File objection within 30 days of assessment notice. Provide supporting evidence. Appeal to Tax Appeal Tribunal if rejected. Can seek judicial review. Use TaxBridge dispute template and legal assistance.

question_en: How is cryptocurrency taxed?
question_pidgin: How dem dey tax cryptocurrency?
answer_en: Crypto treated as capital asset. Capital gains tax: 10% on profits. No VAT on crypto transactions. Must declare holdings in tax returns. Record-keeping essential for cost basis calculation.
answer_pidgin: Crypto be like property for tax. If you sell am for profit, you go pay 10% capital gains tax. No VAT on crypto transactions.

question_en: Tax rules for gig workers and freelancers?
question_pidgin: Tax rules for people wey do freelance work?
answer_en: Register as self-employed. Pay personal income tax annually. Register for VAT if annual income > NGN 25M. Keep all invoices and receipts. Can claim business expenses (internet, equipment, etc.).
answer_pidgin: If you do freelance work, register as self-employed. Pay tax every year. If you make more than NGN 25M, you need VAT. Keep all your papers.

question_en: What are the real estate taxes?
question_pidgin: Wetin be real estate tax?
answer_en: Capital gains tax: 10% on property sales. Rental income: 10% withholding tax if landlord is company, 7.5% VAT on commercial rents. Property tenement rates: state-level, varies by location.
answer_pidgin: If you sell house, you go pay 10% capital gains tax. If you rent out property for business, na 7.5% VAT. State still get their own property tax.

question_en: Tax rules for non-profits and NGOs?
question_pidgin: Tax rules for NGOs and non-profits?
answer_en: Registered NGOs get tax exemption on donations and grants. Must file annual returns. Commercial activities taxed at normal rates. Must maintain proper books and comply with reporting requirements.
answer_pidgin: If your NGO register well, you no go pay tax on donations and grants. But if you do business, you go pay normal tax. You must still file returns every year.

question_en: Can I carry forward tax losses?
question_pidgin: I fit carry tax loss go next year?
answer_en: Yes, business losses can be carried forward for up to 4 years. Cannot be carried back. Must be properly documented and claimed in tax returns. Losses from different business lines cannot be combined.
answer_pidgin: Yes, if your business loss money, you fit use that loss to reduce tax for next 4 years. But you must document am well.

question_en: How do I get VAT refunds?
question_pidgin: How I go get VAT refund?
answer_en: Apply for VAT refund if input tax > output tax. Submit Form VAT 001 with supporting documents. Processing takes 60-90 days. Must have valid TIN and compliant filing history for 6 months.
answer_pidgin: If the VAT wey you pay pass the VAT wey you collect, you fit ask for refund. Fill Form VAT 001 with all your papers. E go take 2-3 months.

question_en: Tax on digital services?
